intro: Fritillaria walujewii, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from deep red to orange and yellow. The plant produces a cluster of narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is typically found in high-altitude environments, often growing at elevations above 2,000 meters. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
